Objective.evidence: This study aimed to evaluate the ability of PVI to predict fluid responsiveness in the modified prone position during cervical spine surgery.

Method_Outcome.evidence: Fluid responsiveness was defined as stroke volume (SV) ≥ 15%, assessed by the FloTrac/Vigileo™ (Edwards Lifesciences Corp, Irvine, CA, USA).

Number_Randomised.evidence: Data from a total of 43 subjects were analyzed.

Number_Analysed.evidence: Data from a total of 43 subjects were analyzed.

Result_Outcome.evidence: the areas under the ROC curves for ΔPVI, ΔSVV, and ΔPPV after fluid loading were 0.524 (95% confidence interval [CI] 0.329–0.730, p = 0.476), 0.749 (95% CI 0.566–0.931, p = 0.004), and 0.790 (95% CI 0.641–0.938, p < 0.001), respectively.
